identification.name: ${project.name}
identification.description: JMS binding Component: Provides a way to interact with message servers from within the JBI environment

config:Property.name: DefaultRedeliveryHandling
config:Property.displayDescription: Default redelivery handling for when no value is supplied in WSDL

config:Property.name: ForceConcurrencyMode
config:Property.displayDescription: Force a concurrency mode which will always override the value specified in WSDL. Use this field if all service units deployed to this BC should use the same settings in order to prevent accidentally omitting a setting.

config:Property.name: ForceMaxConcurrentConsumers
config:Property.displayDescription: Force the maximum number of concurrent consumers to a value which will always override the value specified in WSDL. Use this field if all service units deployed to this BC should use the same settings in order to prevent accidentally omitting a setting. The default value of -1 means that no forced value is present and the value in the WSDL should always be used.

config:Property.name: connectionURL
config:Property.displayDescription: The connectivity information to connect to JMS server

config:Property.name: connectionFactoryName
config:Property.displayDescription: When JNDI is used. this attribute specifies the JNDI name of the connection factory

config:Property.name: initialContextFactory
config:Property.displayDescription: When JNDI is used. this attribute specifies the initial context factory

config:Property.name: providerURL
config:Property.displayDescription: When JNDI is used. this attribute specifies the service provider to use

config:Property.name: securityPrincipal
config:Property.displayDescription: When JNDI is used. this attribute specifies the identity of the principal for authentication

config:Property.name: securityCredentials
config:Property.displayDescription: When JNDI is used. this attribute specifies the credentials of the principal for authentication

config:Property.name: username
config:Property.displayDescription: The user name to use to connect to the JMS server

config:Property.name: password
config:Property.displayDescription: The password to use to connect to the JMS server

config:Property.name: jndienv
config:Property.displayDescription: When JNDI is used this property specifies the environment variables to be used while connecting to the provider. The multiple JNDI environment variables are specified using name=value,name=value format.To escape & use %26 .
